title: Good practice
body: Dr was very helpful on phone however it would be nice to be able to have a face to face appointment now that everything has fully opened up

title: Declining service
body: I've been with this surgery for nearly 15 years and I've never experienced such a bad service as now. It is impossible to contact them, I needed to speak to the GO about my toddler and it took me 2 days before someone actually answered the phone. Then I was told to wait for the doctor to call me back. He did but the next day. I think they are short of staff and should review the whole system in place. After 1 year struggling with this surgery I'm now actively looking for a new one.

title: Experienced a negative reaction
body:
On placing an appointment with a receptionist who appeared pleasant enough it soon became very unhappy when I tried to prevent any issues by explaining that my cared for cannot wear a mask for legitimate reasons. I was treated with rudeness and hostility to the extreme.
I have had such wonderful support from a pharmacist there who was kind enough to go the extra mile. 
The GP was as expected and able to speak to my own GP most of the time.
The other GPs I spoke to were kind and helpful and sympathetic to my issues and have referred me onwards as necessary. 
The practice manager has been quite curt and not helpful in dealing with an issue that was raised with a staff member, this is very disappointing. 
The location is ok if you can walk from the bottom of the sainsburys car park, there is one parking space for disabled people outside the surgery.
A chain has now been removed that prevented access for those in wheelchairs. 
Patients are still being seen outside.
There is now a sign, dated 24th July 2021 that requests masks to be worn unless exempt, which is a great improvement on last week.

title: Fantastic Service
body: Thank you to all the staff and volunteers operating the vaccination programme based at Estuary View. My parents and I have all received two doses now. The drive through system was excellent, the volunteers were fantastic and the nurses and support team were friendly and efficient. You’ve done a brilliant job for our local community. THANK YOU

title: Brilliant, competent, friendly staff, really nice…
body:
I was a former patient of this facility, I didn't know what to expect when I was sectioned so was obviously anxious, scarred and bewildered. I don't know who manages this place but "well fucking done", the staff were amazingly supportive, very friendly, they would happily chat with me and fellow patients, treating us as equals, I've had many memorable conversations with the nurses here, about hobbies, general stuff, anything, they looked after everyone so well I was shocked! 

I was forced to stay for 3 weeks which was a while ago, even so I look back with fond memories of how I was treated as a patient. I was angry at the time because I was held against my will but the nurses/management were all very respectable and quite frankly they were "fucking good at their jobs/being human". Congrats to management/Southport in general/the staff/whatever. You're doing great and deserver better treatment/more pay!

title: An outstanding practice
body: In my experience Parkwood is an outstanding practice. Both my wife and I have made visits within the past few weeks. The desk staff greeted us and dealt with our appointments appropriately, the processes we made use of to book our appointments worked well and the doctors with whom we met were courteous and professional. We both felt strongly that the medical staff with whom we met went to considerable lengths to understand our cases and that they had our best interests and welfare at heart. Thank you to all concerned!

title: Care Less ward 36
body: It pains me very much to write this review having experienced the care and compassion over many years. My wife 80+ is neither senile or incontinent although as had problems due to physical disability, spoke to her on phone at noon today very upset was woken at 7 : 30 and although frequently asking for assistance as been left in a wet and soaking  pad and bed since

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: It was a great practice
body: This used to be a great practice but lately it seems to have gone to pot.  Still has great doctors and some of the staff are really helpful but recently after 4 blood tests cancelled, I’m starting to think enough is enough. Some of us are not only older but disabled and rely on others to bring us.  I have  tried to ring, being told by the auto that I would be put through, then holding on for 8 minutes only to be cut off. Other times it just rang and rang but no answer. I have thought about changing practice’s like a few of my friends but I have decided  to wait to see how the new practice fairs. If the system of answering calls is still the same, then it’s bye to the practice.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Oldham

title: Excellent Care
body: From the initial consultation through to discharge after my hip replacement operation, I received excellent friendly professional care from all staff members that I came into contact with. Everything was explained fully and I was treated with the utmost respect.

title: Shambolic service
body:
Firstly, good luck getting an appointment, - call at 8am and sit in a queue for 30+mins. When you do it's likely a telephone appointment, and even then you're not guaranteed to get thru to a doctor. This is ridiculous when you have an ailment that requires face to face assessment. Not to worry, the receptionists are apparently qualified to judge your symptoms over the phone!
Combining all local services into 1 practice has been a disaster, even in times of Covid basic services are a must and sadly the personal touch has been left behind along with efficiency and friendliness. 
Actually medical staff, when you see them, are courteous and knowledgeable but it's a chore getting to that point.

title: Wonderful practice
body: I rock up at 8.50 with a problem within my eye, they close at 9, had to put horses to bed, they could of said, come back tomorrow, I was examined & treated accordingly, they where at the end of their shift, no doubt a long one too, a big thank you, very much appreciated  amazing ladies, JK

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Generally a very good experience
body:
Fell up steps while out walking. Visited walk-in centre at RVH Folkestone and booked appointment. Was treated extremely well although had to wait a while, understandably. Severe bruising and scraping of shin. I have visited 4 times altogether as could not get an appointment at my surgery for re-dressing.  I could not have asked for better treatment by staff who must be extremely weary and stressed by the circumstances they are having to work under due to Covid restrictions.  Thank you to all the practitioners who treated me.
One criticism is the computer program I had to use to book in which I found to be very user unfriendly which I know is outside the remit of the staff working in the unit.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Care
body: Cannot recommend this practice (and merged South Oxford Health Centre) enough. Whatever the hiring guidelines are, I have never received less than lovely support from the admin staff. The nurses are also so kind and knowledgable and Debbie in particular truly went above and beyond for me. The doctors I have spoken to have also given me solid phone consultations in the last year. Was so happy I could keep the practice when I moved and was still within reasonable distance. Very happy with my choice.

title: Poorly managed
body:
Came to A&E as recommended by 111.
It seems normal that when you come to A&E you’ll have to wait for 4h… 4h30 in the receptionist tells us that the waiting time is now 5h30 maybe 6h. This is ridiculous. The processes to run an hospital are out of date, from the simple check in that takes over 30minutes, 1h before you get seen and then 4h30 waiting for a doctor.
This place is poorly ran and the target should be 0minute wait, don’t aim for 4h. It’s time to spend the money on proper performance consultants and target zero waste!

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Great Service
body: The doctors and staff have been amazing whilst we have been going through a traumatic year. I cannot say how much there help and support has meant through such a difficult time. Thank you to everyone.

title: Can not get appointment avoid all costs!
body: Receptionist should not be triaging appointments for children what ever the issue! appointment for child refused! Then with another issue have to wait weeks and weeks first for telephone G.P appointment who then makes another appointment for you to go to the surgery if necessary. The receptionists make you feel like you are a hypochondriac and ask whether you think the problem is a real emergency ( some patients would not know this? they should be advising the patient? hence why should be medically trained!) Extremely dangerous way to practice things will be missed! Only medically trained staff should be triaging. Due to this G.P surgery's frustrating poor service I  have had to sign family to local private G.P surgery.

title: 12 hours wait with 1 doctor only for 5…
body:
So poor service, Saturday night and only 1 doctor for 85 patients and 5 departments. Wait nearly 12 hours and on and morning staff rude. 
When asked how long more to wait the staff said “you can leave and go somewhere else”
That’s how  “OUR” tax payers money being spend back to us. 
Worst service at its peak

readBy.name: Healthwatch Oldham
Pennine Acute Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Awful communication skills
body: Every receptionist i’ve spoken to has been extremely rude and when i asked to speak to their manager as i felt they weren’t taking my queries seriously, she was even ruder to me!

title: I felt scared and very vulnerable
body: I was given pain relief after a long wait, then wheelchair into the becon waiting room on my own, whilst waiting for my husband to collect me, I was very high on medication being very sick bent over in the wheel chair on my own for some while, human kindness is what you need when feeling unwell. Upsetting and traumatic experience.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Isle of Wight

title: Help when I needed it
body: Though the eConsult service can be a little daunting, once you get the hang of it, response times by the surgery are good. The doctors I have dealt with are warm, sympathetic and very helpful over the phone and have given me good support over last few months. The reception staff at Wexham Road are also great

title: Help
body: I find it almost impossible to see a Dr and speak in person in regards to my child's progress and have been unable give feedback as to the issues we deal with at home visits are often shorter than advised I feel like yher no communication

title: Rubbish Department
body: My mother was taken into Good Hope, one hour latter; the phone rang and whoever was calling. Only let the phone ring THREE times before hanging off. Tried to call back, no one was answering the phones

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient response
body: After completing an e consult, I was advised by text a dr would contact me on a certain day.  My GP called me on the day they advised.  I was given an appointment that day, referred to a consultant and had a hospital appointment a week or so later.

title: Never again
body:
My son has a long-term health condition needing regular surgery. 
He was in the kind of pain that can result in emergency surgery.  We were told by his specialist nurse to go to Northwick Park A&E and tell the staff to contact his consultant.  We arrived at 3pm and sat for 4 hours in a packed A&E waiting room while my son was in continuous pain.  The reception staff were rude and uncommunicative, ignoring my request to contact my son's consultant and telling us to tell the nurse when we saw her, which wasn't for hours.  A sign on the wall said that capacity for the waiting room was 30 but there were at least 50+ people in there.  No social distancing and many people were not wearing masks.  Nobody challenged them on this, despite security staff being ever-present.  A child came in with his father, who told the staff 'he has started coughing and won't stop'.  The child was running round the waiting room coughing, with no face covering.  Nobody stopped him.  We felt unsafe and uncared for.  Eventually we were put in a small room with 4 other people - a man throwing up, a woman shouting and another woman coughing.  Again, no masks, so we went to stand in the corridor and were told we couldn't. I kept trying to tell the staff that all we needed was for them to phone our consultant but I was ignored. It was so worrying.  At 10pm we finally saw a doctor who understood what was going on.  It was such a relief.   We completely understand the pressures that the staff were under but we didn't feel safe there.  A memo went round to all staff during our stay, it told them that Covid cases were rapidly rising.  Having spent all that time in A&E I'm not suprised!   The whole place was dirty and no measures were put in place to make people wear masks and socially distance.  The only people who got any attention during our time there were a drunk woman and a homeless man - they had security and nurses following them around the corridors while they roamed about, again without masks.  If my son had not been in so much pain I would have left and tried our luck in another hospital.  Northwick Park A&E is not fit for purpose.  It badly lets down our amazing NHS.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Receptionist was so kind and amazing!!
body:
I called the reception today (25/7) at 2:12pm because I was worried about my sister (she had a baby with her) and the lady was being so wonderful and comforting over the phone. She even went to speak to my sister to check on her to give me an update, which was the kindest thing.

I forgot to ask for her name, but I really hope she sees this because I really want to say thank you and give her a virtual hug!!!

Diana xox

title: Wonderful professional team
body: I attended an appointment in the Endoscopy department recently and would like to convey my sincere thanks to all staff from reception to recovery . Their professional and dedicated approach make them invaluable.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Lovely kind staff
body: Visited today for a cystoscopy what lovely kind and caring staff really reassuring as I was very dubious about the procedure.  Lovely consultant who was also very kind. They all work so hard.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing nurse and smear test
body:
Had a very good experience with the nurse who did my smear test. Going to her reassures me to go back every three years on time. Shes gentle, kind, and considerate. Cannot ask for more! 
In general all the doctors are very helpful, and efficient. You get seen quite quickly.
The only thing I'd recommend is widening their catchment area to greater shooters hill as I want to recommend them to friends and family.

title: Great Service
body: The doctors and staff have been amazing whilst we have been going through a traumatic year. I cannot say how much there help and support has meant through such a difficult time. Thank you to everyone.

title: Customer care
body: Im a elderly gentleman and the Customer care at the medical centre is great! I have never been disappointed, a member of staff took there time booking two of my appointments and were very friendly and patient with me always.

title: Great care
body: I visited Central Middlesex for my son's MRI.  It's a lovely building, really spacious, modern and clean.  This is really reflected in the staff, who seem genuinely pleased to work there!  We were seen quickly and the nurse was great.  I wish I'd taken his name.  A really positive experience all round.  We have heard that my son's regular treatment might be moved from Northwick Park to Central Middlesex.  I can only hope that this is true.  There is no comparison between the two.  Northwick Park is dirty, understaffed and overcrowded, Central Middlesex is the opposite.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Unprofessional
body:
I had blood test couple of test came abnormal I’ve been told GP will call u.
When she called all she gave me test results I asked for treatment all she she said I don’t know I asked for Medicines she replied there’s no medicine for this. All she was rushing. Not happy at all. Change if my Gp now.
Don’t recommend to no one if u really love ur family and urself pls avoid this surgery.

author: echomx83
title: Blood transfusion in the day clinic
body:
I came in today with my nephew for a blood transfusion which has gone great. I am very happy with my experience today- the staff in particular are brilliant!  
I was here in time for lunch so I had some jam sponge cake with custard, it was lovely and sweet, I really enjoyed it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Appointments
body: I initially had an appointment with gynaecology for Monday 26th July, so I booked a day off work. You then had to change the appointment to the 25th. I made arrangements. I received a call five days before I was due to be seen telling me the appointment has to be changed again. Unfortunately I’m away at the end of August and September I’m due to begin a uni placement, of which Mondays are a crucial day and nearly impossible to get off, especially since I’ve been called to jury service that month and had to have special allowances made already. You provisionally booked me for a Monday in September advising that if I do need to change it (which I’m 99% sure I will) then I could get in touch. I just received the confirmation letter saying that I was the one who cancelled my appointment for the 25th and that if I do it again I’ll be reviewed and passed back to my GP to be re referred. I find this incredibly upsetting and unfair, given that I made every effort to be available for the first two appointment dates. I’m likely to not get seen for a long time, if at all. Since a problem was found in May I’ve been really nervous and eager to get it checked out, and I now feel totally hopeless. I don’t blame the appointments staff for this series of unfortunate events, and as I work in healthcare I understand how things can go wrong with the clinic sometimes. But with the notice you were able to give me, surely a locum could have been arranged? Really really disappointing service.

readBy.name: Lewisham and Greenwich NHS Trust

title: The best care
body:
I was admitted to hospital in mid Feb, after a positive Covid-19 test, with a constant cough, unfortunately my condition became worse and I was eventually taken into critical care.
Even though some of my memories of my seven weeks in hospital are hazy, one thing was constant throughout, that was the excellent care I received all through my stay, from the consultants, doctors, nurses, cleaning staff and catering staff.
Without a doubt I owe my life to the skill and devotion of the staff.
My family and I cannot thank them enough for getting me through the illness.
I am still having breathing problems, but I am happy to put up with that just to still be here.
I would like to thank all the staff individually, but appreciate that’s not possible, so a great big collective thank you to all on ward C2 from myself and family.
Thank you for my future.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Thank you
body: Was visiting my mother today 25th with my sister who fell as she got out of the car 3 nurses came to my rescue and helped my sister up even getting moving and handeling equipment they were very pleasant and nothing was a bother kind and considerate sorry I carnt remember your names but thank you once again you should be very proud of your staff this was beyond their duties

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic team
body: I attended the walk-in COVID vaccination today. Injections are my worst nightmare and typically I hit the floor almost every time after having one. I really did not want to be there but my experience was fantastic. Upon arriving I was greeted by a friendly receptionist then by a man looking after sending people to appropriate rooms. I made them aware of my fear and they could not have been better. I was in the room within minutes. The two nurses in the room were super friendly and put me at ease straight away. They knew I didn’t want to see the needle or be told anything about what was going on. I had the injection and then waited fifteen minutes before returning home. Overall really pleasant experience and all of the team should be proud! I am now not as worried about returning in 8 weeks for the second jab. Hopefully it will be with the same team!

title: Great service
body: I called this morning to book an appointment for a doctor. No problem with getting through on the phone and the receptionist I spoke to was very knowledgeable. Doctor called back within the hour and was so understanding and I was referred the same day to the Whittington.  Great service.

author: User23July2021
title: Very compassionate
body: I had my HyCoSy test today at the Gynaecology department. The complete team was very compassionate.   Dr. El-Sayed and his team explained each step of the procedure and the findings which made  me feel very comfortable. I did not have any pain during the procedure. I had a blood test followed by the procedure. Overall really thankful to the team.

readBy.name: Dartford and Gravesham NHS Trust

title: An extremely good practice
body: Registered here a few years ago when I moved into the area. Always easy to book appointments. Staff (both admin and clinical) are polite and professional with very good communication skills. The Limes is one of the few practices I know where clinicians have continued to see patients face to face throughout Covid. Also, my 18 year old son received his first Covid vaccine weeks before the Government target for his age group. Overall, to date, a very impressive practice!

title: Alstone ward staff
body: Today I left the Alstone ward after knee surgery, every single member of staff that cared for me I would like to thank so much, they were all truly amazing and quite honestly never stopped working hard, I hope they manage to see this and know how appreciative I am, the very reason our NHS is the best!

title: Brilliant Service and Staff
body: Staying with a friend to convalesce after an operation, I developed a nasty allergy to the dressing.  As it was a Saturday, and my GP was back home in Bude, it was a real relief to find that the Cumberland Centre was nearby and open all day. The staff were efficient and friendly and after a relatively short wait I left with the offending dressing removed and a new non- irritating one in situ.   Great alternative if your GP. is not available and not serious enough for A & E.  Devonport residents are lucky to have such a service on their doorstep seven days of the week.  Thank you

readBy.name: Livewell South West

title: Bad service
body: I was come before and late 10 minutes so they give me another application for the scan . Second time i come early 10 minutes they keep me set for 40 minutes with out reason!! No interpreter and the scan take just 5 minutes!! Every thing quickly she does allow me to ask any questions because she do everything quick now i see my baby face scan and i thing therefore some thing in his head but I do not know who i should ask ?! Rude resiption and scan nurse . I'm really disappointed with this day I'm waiting from 6 months.

readBy.name: Lewisham and Greenwich NHS Trust

title: Exemplary help from the medical assessor
body: On Thursday July 22nd 2021 I went to the walk in centre having had a bad fall and bitten a chunk out of my lip. The welcome staff were very welcoming and helpful, but the medical assessor who finally saw me gave tremendous advice and suggested I went straight to Whiston Hospital in Prescot rather than going to Southport A&E, as they would probably just refer me to Whiston anyway. He then contacted Whiston hospital himself and arranged a time for me to be at A&E and then at the Plastics Trauma unit the next day.  I am enormously grateful to him for doing this, as my lip was repaired within 2 hours of arriving at Whiston! Unfortunately, I do not know the medical assessor's name but I would like to thank him very sincerely for his actions and advice. He also advised me to speak to my GP about the reason for my falls and I will indeed do so tomorrow. Thank you very much. The NHS really is a national treasure and we are so lucky to have it! Clare Winstanley

title: Life Saving
body: Transplant - Mant thanks to all the Team involved, also the donor/family. Literally saved my life. Professional, Caring and Compassionate during the entire process. Thank you for being you. XX

title: The food is VILE!
body: The food is grim!  I've been here 8 days now and the food is shockingly bad!  I've been through most things on the menu now.  The food is repetitive, bland, warm or cold, sandwiches with boring fillings, soggy toast and never enough salt/pepper other condiments given. My partner is bringing food in for me it's so bad and yet I came from another NHS hosp and the food there was so tasty and hot. The pre packed salad and pre packed fruit desserts are probably the best thing and the hot chocolate.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Almost impossible to get an appointment
body:
Very difficult to get in touch on the phone with delays typically lasting an hour. Worse, even when they do answer, I have been told multiple times “I have rung at the wrong time” to do such and such – the phone then goes dead. 

Frankly, if I wait for an hour on the phone, what exactly is the problem with just dealing with my issue whatever it is? Clearly making an appointment is too taxing for these people. Anyhow, the consequence of all this is that after four years, I still don't know what my new GP looks like.

There was a time when you just rang a GP and asked for an appointment. These days you need to ring in an artificially narrow time window, and also know what is wrong with you before you can even ask for an appointment. Silly me; and there was I thinking it was the doctor's job to work out what was wrong with me.

title: Concerned patient
body: The worst GP surgery I have ever visited all the staff and doctors are unprofessional and do not show any care towards patients repeat prescriptions are always a battle to get and require numerous phone calls and emails appointments are impossible to get and if you do get an appointment the doctor just wants you in and out as quickly as possible I will be moving GP shortly as there is no sign of Lime Square getting any better there must be an audit organisation that can assess and close down

title: Care with kindness
body: I attended the pre-operative swabbing clinic. Despite late arrival caused by a road closure, I was treated with great patience by the staff who had waited half an hour. The swabbing process and associated blood sampling and ECG test were carried out with calm kindness which helped to mitigate the unpleasantness of the procedure. Everything was well-organized and my dignity and comfort were clearly important. My thanks to the staff for their patience, reassuring demeanour and expression of good wishes for the upcoming surgery. This is the human and humane side of the NHS.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Communication not great.
body: Starting seeing GP in 01/2021. Complain about my lump on my back I know it was a size of a pea but he just said it was a ache spot under the skin gave me antibiotics and loads of tests which frighten the lift out of me, no communication with me from him or the nurse. Kept asking what the test were for cancer,antibodies in my kidneys. Have about 10 blood test and a scan. After the scan I waited for a few weeks nothing from the doctor about my results I had to ring them he said to worry about very is fine see you in February  I replied what about my lump on my back he replied see you in February. I couldn’t believe what I was hearing. So I changed doctors they said it was a cyst on my back and now waiting for appointment to have it removed but the fact of leaving so long we don’t know the damage it’s done . So thanks for nothing.

title: Fantastic Team
body: I have been on Surgery Hysterectomy. I was feeling safely, and I want To Say a Huge Thank You for all team was worked there. I will recommended this places. I've meet a fantastic people's from the personel. Thank You So Much. Beata J.

title: Waste of my time
body: Unwell baby. 2 hour call back, been waiting 6 hours so far and still no call! Chased up 2 hours ago and told I’ll get called ‘soon’.  In meantime baby still unwell. Not impressed at all when a baby is ignored. Such a good thing to have when it’s managed properly.

title: The curates  Egg
body:
Doctors and Nursing staff are excellent,very caring and all very professional, however the reception is a total disaster area, Phones not answered,often an hour wait to speak to someone, ignored by reception staff when standing in front of window, some staff unhelpful surley and rude.I order my repeat scripts online a very quick process Sent direct to chemist. I believe reception is going through a thorough 
 improvement process at the moment i hope it will improve,
Very sorry to hear of the sudden departure of the practice Manager, very helpful and will be missed.

title: Severely lacking in most aspects
body:
I can understand the current climate we're in because of Covid, but it seems they've done EVERYTHING possible to avoid providing ANY sort of actual help. 
Their immediate answer is to send you to A&E without any sort of actual investigation or care. They DON'T want to see you, not live, not on the phone, not at all.
Calling here is a chore because of the phone queues, then you wait forever for a "doctor" to call back, then you're either blindly prescribed medicine based on the few bits of info you provide or straight up told to go to A&E instead of allowing you to come in and be seen as a patient.
Then you go to A&E for 4 hours where you're seen and prescribed a basic antibiotic which GP could have done in less than 10 minutes. Pure madness.
Went to register there, we were treated like dogs begging for food, spoken to thru the intercom or thru a slant of a window like lepers. The "quality" of the discussions with the reception is always below standards, they're rude and expeditive, IF you manage to see a doctor, then and only then you see a shred of normality.

title: AWFUL
body: I have submitted online form to register for GP as I moved recently to the area. Online form mentioned that "the practice will send me sms within 5 days asking to attach my proof of address". More than 3 weeks have passed, I have not received any sms, nor any update. I have called them several times and the hotline officer told me that they are very busy. This is very unprofessional. I still don't have an NHS number.

title: Absolutely disgusted
body: I phoned 111 as i was really worried about my 4 year olds temperature as ive have been giving her calpol and its still just rising. She started saying her neck was hurting so i called for some advice and i was told we would get a call back in 6 hours as they were really busy. I waited up for the 6 hours and no one at all called back at all. I am disgusted as this is a child and i cannot use the online service as shes under 5 so it seems like we just get ignored. This is absolutely disgusting and animals get treated better than this

title: Worse practice ever
body: I have never known a doctors surgery like this, you look online to get help about your mental health problems and it always state's if your feeling low down or suicidal speak with your GP they will help you since I was diagnosed with having Depression & anxiety and suicidal thoughts and attempts and other health problems you would think that my GP would check on how I'm doing from time-to-time well not this Doctors I find this surgery very poor my medication is on repeat prescription so I never have regular checks and during Covid-19 when I needed there help I never got it and I can't understand why I can't see my doctor still only phone consultations given when other Doctors are back working again It just seems to be mine also I requested a full medical report 3 Months ago for something Important yet I've been told from the head of the reception that they haven't had time yet to even look at it my Doctor has told them to do my medical report but not got the time yet what a big joke I asked 3 Months ago how much time is needed

author: Mrssb
title: Long Covid in Children
body:
I had just turned 39 when I fell ill with Covid towards the end of March 20. I didn’t realise what it was at first, as I didn’t have any of the listed symptoms at the time and there wasn’t any community testing available, so I didn’t isolate from my family. By the time I deteriorated with breathing problems and chest pain, it was too late - I had passed it on to my family.  
My husband, also 39, had an increase in his usual seasonal allergy symptoms and shortness of breath (SOB). My daughter, who was 7 at the time, had SOB and chest pain, a sore throat and sore eyes. My little boy, who was 5 at the time, was very ill for around 6 weeks – awful cough that made him vomit, fever, skin rashes, sore eyes, sore throat with inability to swallow, change of taste and heightened smell, shortness of breath, increased heartrate, and vomiting & diarrhoea.  
My daughter initially recovered but a couple of months later was having chest pains and SOB again as well as an increased heartrate, a bloody nose, increased allergies, eye floaters, burst blood vessels in her eyes, lightburn and visual disturbances. The GP diagnosed her as asthmatic over the phone without seeing her or any tests and prescribed inhalers. I mentioned covid but insisted it was just coincidence. The optician said she now has a exposed sclera – the blue bit behind the white of the eye. She also has bulging new veins all over her body and spider veins on her face.  
My son has seen some symptoms disappear but new ones appear. His cough finally went after 3 months, but he was left with a feeling of not being able to swallow for a further 5 months and still has regular swollen glands. He has the most horrific nosebleeds with blood gushing from nose. His skin rashes stopped, but the eye problems continue – burst blood vessels, blurred vision and deterioration in previously perfect vision with a new prescription for short sightedness. He is also left with a sensitive stomach and his taste has changed along with a heightened smell. He also has joint pain in his knees and he says, my head doesn’t feel right or there’s something missing. He also has bulging veins all over his body.  
Getting medical help for me was difficult; for them, almost impossible.  
They fell ill in April 2020 and we finally accessed an in-person physical check-up and blood tests in September. The GP admitted they looked unwell and noted the veins but still said, blood tests are not pleasant for children and are very invasive, are you sure? It made my husband and I feel we were overreacting, it was awful. Torn between getting medical help for our children and trusting our instincts, or being painted as the over-anxious parents wasting everyone’s time. The bloods actually came back abnormal and we were finally referred to a paediatrician.  
Help at last. Or so we thought.  
We were seen by the local paediatrics in February 21. The receptionist said they had seen many children suffering with prolonged symptoms after Covid. We were devastated to hear about other children suffering but also relieved we were not alone.  
The paediatrician we saw was kind and checked them over as best they could. They said it did sound like Long Covid, but admitted they didn’t know enough about the condition to help. However, the paediatrician said there was a Long Covid clinic especially for children at Evelina Hospital in London, which she referred them to. Another sigh of relief from us – help AND validation!  
After a few weeks, I hadn’t heard anything, so I called to chase. The administrator said that some cases are being rejected but they would do everything they could to help. An anxious wait for a few days, but the receptionist then called me back with the news that the Infectious Disease Department had indeed rejected them, but they were going to be seen under General Paediatrics instead. We had an appointment for a month’s time.  
The day before the appointment, I got a call from the Head of Paediatrics at Evelina hospital. They said they are cancelling the appointment and they’re discharged from the hospital because they don’t have the funding to deal with Long Covid in children yet.  
The despair and frustration was horrific. How could they dismiss sick children just like that? All those months of waiting, of fighting for help - over, just like that!  
The staff member couldn’t apologise enough and said there is supposed to be a Long Covid clinic for children there but they haven’t received funding yet. Long Covid Clinics for children didn’t exist. Once again they said they are doing everything they can and acknowlledged that there are many children suffering, that children DO get Long Covid and there are families fighting for answers and she feels terrible they can’t help.  
Our current appointment with the local paediatrician is in January 2022. And that call from Evelina was over a month ago now. We don’t hold out much hope.  
We feel like nobody cares about Long Covid in children & that nobody cares about the unknown impact on their health, now or in the future.  
And we’re the lucky ones!  
Other families’ children are being left paralysed, suffering seizures and/or coughing up blood from Covid and they’re being diagnosed with anxiety! Forced to attend school when they are desperately ill. It’s like some kind of collective denial amongst some medical staff. We feel that it beggars belief that this is happening to children in the UK in the year 2021. What’s going on?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Exhausted Patient
title: Talking to a non-qualified person about my health
body:
I need a prescription for a Hydrocortisone cream, a steroid for allergic reaction on my skin caused by a medicated face mask. I went to my pharmacy, where I was advised that they All at pharmacy had the same bad allergic reaction to a batch of face masks last week, and that I need a Hydrocortisone cream, which is only available on prescription. I went to my surgery only to be told that there no doctor's appointments for the next 2 weeks, that I can try calling surgery everyday at 8 am by phone to get emergency appointment. well, it is almost impossible to get through on the phone at 8am, tried it several times before.  
The Surgery advised me to call NHS 111 number.  
I called that number, went through many hoops with the automated queuing system for almost 7 minutes. A consultant answered my call. They asked me at least 10 questions, first to verify who I was, then about my health problem. In the end they advised to call my surgery and see my GP in order to get a prescription for Hydrocortisone cream,  
I told this person that I cannot get an appointment with my GP even for next week and I cannot get a prescription for more than a week. That the problem was with the surgery and the staff working in the reception, who were completely unhelpful, and doing nothing at all to help me.  
I found this interaction with NHS-111 pointless. I felt it abused my trust, because I spoke to a person who is just a telephone operator, with no medical qualifications what so ever.  
This person read out a lot of pointless questions, that have Nothing to do with my health problem.  
In the end this person tells me to telephone my surgery and book an appointment with your GP.  
Basically, I spoke to someone who knows Nothing about health or medications. I told them my personal health problems, but this person is not equipped in any way what so ever to help me with my medical problem because this person is not a doctor. This person is not even an experienced nurse - it is absolutely Nobody in terms of health/ medical issues.  
Now, that I look back on the conversation I had with this nobody, I feel angry because I should have asked who I was speaking to at the very beginning of conversation.  
I do not know why I trusted NHS, that I would be speaking with a professional, medical person about my health and my personal details. I consider that my trust was betrayed.  
What is the purpose of talking to a Non-Qualified person about my health problems?  
The Non-Qualified person employed by NHS could not help me in any way with my predicament - namely - I need a prescription for Hydrocortisone cream, because they are not a qualified doctor.  
Yet, I told them at the very beginning that I needed a prescription for a steroid cream.  
They should have told me at the beginning that they could not give me a prescription, because they were not a doctor, instead of going through the entire rigmarole of irrelevant questions - to tell me at the end to telephone my Surgery and ask to see my GP.  
Round and round we go - that was my outcome from NHS 111  
The Surgery tells its patient to call NHS 111, and NHS 111 tells the patient to call the surgery.  
Round and round we go - no wonder there are more and more people suffering mental health issues - this alone can drive one round the bend.  
A Very Frustrated, Angry and Disappointed NHS patient  
I am sure one of many millions Very Frustrated, Angry and Disappointed NHS patients.  
The whole system is disintegrating !  
I feel on my own and that I will not get help from the NHS Surgery when I need it  
I may get help in a hospital, but I must be close to dying.

author: EstherQoP
title: A referral I need to join a pottery group
body:
I have recently been through the single point of access where I was referred onto a course for managing emotions through STEP. There is a 6 month waiting list. In the meantime there is a question of what I am going to do until then. My friend is doing a course in pottery at the Art House in Sheffield. My friend's son is a volunteer there. I have never tried pottery and was keen to get involved. I was informed there was enough room for me to join. However, they needed me to be referred by Sheffield Health and Social Care (SHSC). I contacted the STEP team and they said they couldn't refer me. I am aghast at the lack of initiative shown for someone to make a phone call on my behalf. I am being proactive in self-help and knew that the pottery course would be of great therapeutic benefit.  
Instead, the member of staff I spoke to from SHSC I felt, hid behind policy and said they didn't make referrals. It's not me, granted, but if I had taken my call I would've gone the extra mile (or in this case a few steps) to enable me to access the pottery course. To say that all is needed is a call or letter to confirm that I am in the system I feel really let down. The person at the other end of the phone for SHSC told me they could understand my frustration. I beg to differ.  
To say that AMBITION is one of the SHSC's values I see very little shown here. I am sick of being passed from pillar to post.  
How difficult is it to make a phone call?

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sheffield
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
NHS Sheffield ICB

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Being told about the scan the night before would have saved rushing
body: I came into the emergency department on Friday past and spent a few days there on a trolly beds but the staff eventually got me a hospital bed and I was made much more comfortable. I was soon moved to 1 south where the staff have been so lovely eventhough they are super busy all the time. I sometimes just wish there was a little more communication with scan times. For example yesterday I was woke at 8 and told to rush with carers round me to make a scan at 8. 20am. I am an elderly woman and we like to take our time and get quite panicky when rushed especially when you are only just awake. The carers were still lovely and apologetic but I feel if I was told a time to be ready the night before I could have been up and ready to go at my own pace and save everyone rushing. The staff down at the theatre are lovely. The ward is very clean, sometimes the toilets could be cleaner but this is not the staffs fault it is some patients fault. Maybe more regular checking would be suffice to resolve this issue.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: woodpeckerfy48
title: Amersham physio outpatients
body:
I called Amersham outpatients to ask about my daughters referral this week, I wanted to know about waiting times to decide if I should opt for private physio.  
I found them to be chaotic, unprepared to help my query and quite rude. I didn’t get an answer and they said they were very busy to say how long it would be. I feel dissatisfied with their service and not sure if I’ll take the appt when it arrives. I would like The staff in this department to be advised about how they speak to patients over the phone as it was negative and totally unprofessional.

readBy.name: Buckinghamshire Healthcare NHS Trust

author: lesleyb56
title: My visit to A&E
body:
I arrived at Lincoln A&E at 12.15 pm approx and was seen by a Triage Nurse then a Doctor.  
Then I was sent for an X-ray on my shoulder.  
After this was done I was sent to the wrong waiting area.  
The nurse came to find me eventually and took me to an area where I should have been waiting.  
Then I was sent for an MRI and told to wait in A&E reception for a Consultant to see me and give me some more Oral Morphine  
I sat there for another 3 hours waiting in chronic back pain and in tears....at 8.15 I decided to ask at reception what was going on?  
Only to be told by the nurse on reception that they were waiting for a bed as I was being admitted!!!!!  
I collapsed in tears from the upset and stressful day.  
NOBODY had come and informed me of this, the Nurses, Consultant and Doctor seemed to have completely forgotten about me being there.  
I was finally taken to Shuttleworth Ward.  
It was the most horrendous day of my life.  
I had gone nearly 10 hours in horrendous back pain with only water to drink and nothing to eat.  
I was then discharged from the ward on Wednesday lunch time and sent home without any medication.  
Even though the discharge paperwork stated they were sending medication home with me.  
I had to go to my GP for Oral Morphine and Codeine.  
My Gp is disgusted with the way I was treated.  
I myself feel completely let down by your A&E department and am still extremely upset by the whole experience.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

author: footballhb43
title: What happened was totally unacceptable
body: My husband was in for an overnight stay. He has mixed dementia and was sent home in a taxi by himself with no thought as to whether anyone was at home or whether he had any keys. which he didn't. I was not consulted by anyone on the ward as had I been I would have come up to escort him home the same way I escorted him in for his op. what happened was totally unacceptable.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Efficient Service
body: I needed to book an appointment for a review prior to a regular prescription. I filled in an online form for an appointment request (this is far easier than waiting on the phone for 30 mins). Somebody called me back that day and advised that i didnt need an appointment on this occasion and if i simply wrote a letter to the practise with certain information they could send the prescription to my local pharmacy. This was done so efficiently i cannot thank them enough! Trying to get an appointment when working full time can really be a chore. But they made the process so easy!

title: Horrible service
body: I would never ever recommend this practice to anyone. Horrendous service, receptionist even more horrible than service provided. Impossible to get a medical assistance when you need it. No point of existence of this centre

title: Terrible service
body: You can’t get anyone on the phone within a reasonable time, call back doesn’t work, you can’t get sameday appointments, every time you speak to admin or reception you get told to do an e consult! They don’t want to deal with face to face at all and getting eye contact is impossible!

title: Appalling practice
body: The reception staff here are rude abrasive and difficult to deal with.  Trying to get to speak with a nurse or doctor is nearly impossible as the receptionists keep telling you no-one is available call 111.  If you do manage to get a call back from someone they ask you to basically diagnose yourself and will only arrange a face to face under extreme circumstances.   Nine time out of ten though if you want to see some one they tell you to goto the hospital.  As a hospital worker I find this response to be horrendous as we are already stretched and don't need lazy GPs sending their unwanted work to an already overworked hospital

readBy.name: Healthwatch Hampshire

title: totally useless frustrating telephone system
body: can't speak to a real human being without having to sit for hours at a time listening to the same distorted music and robotic voice on a loop and being told your being moved back in the "call que" they seriously need to get rid of this system and bring back REAL human beings without this frustrating system being involved!

title: Rubbish phone system
body: Telephone system is a joke, phoned multiple times and was in the que 5 times alltogether then got to second in the que and then to be hung up on. Trying to get an appointment for my 11month old baby who has a rattly chest.

title: Hopeless - impossible to make an appointment
body:
Simply wanted to make an appointment (either with a nurse or Dr). Called at 9am - on hold for 10 minutes to be told that no more appointments for today and hung up on. Went to the practice. Told that you can only book appointments for the same day and "there aren't very many". Recommended to phone at "about 8:15" each morning to try and make an appointment for the same day.

My problem isn't that urgent, I am happy to make an appointment for tomorrow or later this week. The appointments exist, but I am not allowed to book one, I have to try my luck on the phone on the day!

Absolutely hopeless.

readBy.name: NHS Sheffield ICB
The Crookes Practice
Healthwatch Sheffield

title: 2 hours baking in the car
body: After a phone call with the 111 where i explained all the symptoms (positive cpr test as well) i went to the a&e to have a visit. None of the nurses asked me about Covid so they suggested me to have a sit and wait. After 1 hour and half i went back to the reception asking for updates and nothing. Luckly i've heard a young girl saying that she was positive so immediately the nurse sent her outside to wait and at that stage i said that i was positive as well. 111 didn't communicate at the hospital that i was positive to Covid when they booked me in, unbelievable! After my visit they told me to wait inside my car wearing a face mask. There was 35°C and i started to bake myself, after 2 hours i left because i didn't have water with me (all vending machines were empty) and i started to feel unwell. 1 hour later i get the phone call from the nurse to discuss my results. Really disappointed !! This is not the right way to treat and take care of Covid patients !!

title: Pooor
body: Not surprised with the findings of the recent survey of the performance I have had such a poor service from this surgery ie incorrect information with my blood test by the receptionist no follow up recommendations etc I have moved to a different GP what a difference in the attitude of the staff cannot do enough for you

title: Excellent Treatment
body: The care, consideration of all staff at The Westbourne Centre cannot be faulted.  I would have no hesitation in recommending The Centre for the professionalism shown during my visits over the past few months.  I was immediately put at ease and reassured from the initial consultation.  I am still amazed at the difference the cataract operation has made.  A new lease of life!

title: Closing 45 mins before 9pm
body: My sister attended with her child who had sustained an upper limb injury 45 minutes before 9pm. On arriving a nice administration person said sorry we have no doctors, however a nurse then arrived and informed them it was closed? Why have it on the website you are open till 9pm if that’s not the case?? What is the use of a walk in centre but other than try to relieve pressure on the accident and emergency departments?

title: The staff can't do enough for you
body: The staff have always been really supportive to me and my family.  They are always happy to help.  I'd be happy to recommend the Practice.

title: Awful surgery
body: I called 109 times today starting at 8am before getting through to reception at 10am. To be told no appointments left. I had an appointment last week that the surgery messed up by calling at the wrong time, I called back straight away to be told that the slot had now gone. Reception staff are rude and condescending.

title: Poor attitude to patients needs
body:
After calling 111 in regards to an infected insect bite on my 3 year old son, I received a call back from a GP at this survey. I explained that I had been to the pharmacy earlier on that morning and had been advised that the bite was infected and he required antibiotics hence my call to 111. I explained to the GP that my son had a large open wound was in severe pain and also had a temperature which would have been due to the infection. He told me that in most cases a hydrocortisone cream would be used, I explained the pharmacist had already advised not to use this cream. He then proceeded to tell me that if my son showed any sign of a temperature upon attending the surgery that he would be turned away as he wasn’t prepared to see him. I explained that his temperature was his body trying to fight the infection away, he just repeated as before he wouldn’t see him and he would be turned away but if I wanted to still pop down to do so. I ask what my options would be if he did have a temperature when I arrive he again said he wouldn’t be seen and sent to the children’s hospital! 
I took my son to the surgery anyway and upon my arrival was told the GP would be informed I was here, I wasn’t told where to wait until about 20 minutes later when another member of staff brought out a prescription for another patient. Another GP then come to the door took our temperatures, my sons was a little high but she said not to worry and invited us in.I explained what her colleague said and she told me he wasn’t very diplomatic and that she was quite happy to see my son. He was given antibiotics and had his wound dress, I thanked the doctor that saw us and explained my frustrations in regards to her colleague. I had no issues at all with the GP who saw us she was very kind caring and understand. 
I completely understand the need for precaution at the moment due to covid but I had waited 5 hrs for my initial call back, to the be told he would be turned away if he showed a sign of a temperature. It’s disgusting that a child of the age of 3 can be refused treatment, I knew he had an infection that needed to be treated as soon as possible. Had the GP that called me been the person who we had been presented with at the surgery he would have turned us away and we would have had a very very long wait at the children hospital.

title: Unable to Contact
body: Have been trying to Contact Via phone for over a month. Have had to resort to contacting 111 just to get hold of my GP. Services are very limited even though Restrictions have been lifted. Extremely hard to get an over the phone consultation and Online Booking System is disabled.

title: Absolutely disorganised
body: I got an appointment by phone (after a waiting of 45 minutes) for the first vaccination of my baby at 9 in the morning and i received a text message confirmation like usual. My boyfriend took the day off from work and when we arrived a lady at the reception said that there wasn’t any appointment for my baby. I showed her a confirmation message but nothing changed. I asked to see a gp today anytime but it was not possible. I want to complain about the bad organisation of this surgery and the total inability to handle with the problem. This disorganisation can’t be possible in this period of Covid considering the time you have to wait by phone to speak to someone and the long wait before having an appointment. We are far from the surgery too, absolutely upset!

readBy.name: NHS Leeds ICB

author: Zanetux
title: Stopping smoking
body: I stopped smoking very easy taking Champix (after 4 days). At the same time my partner was stopping which was beneficial for both of us as we could support each other. It was more difficult at work as there is also a social aspect to smoking but much easier at home. I used Champix without any side effects. I definitely feel a lot healthier and would advise anyone thinking of stopping to go for it. And nurse Valerie support was very important and very helpful to me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mr nice
title: Amazing people
body: I have to say been going to Stafford team for 8 years now they are a credit to you amazing people always made to feel welcome and always do a great job.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: mad march hare
title: A weeks stay
body:
I have just arrived home after spending this week in Craigavon Area Hospitals "Blossom" ward, which my 3 month old granddaughter had been admitted to on Monday evening with a Urine Infection.  
The care, kindness, and support given to both of us from EVERYONE was amazing, I couldn't fault these people in any way whatsoever. Nothing was too much trouble from them at all.  
A huge thank you to you all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: earthbh33
title: Covid-19 Jab
body: I came in for my second Covid-19 jab, and I’m so happy and relieved to have received it! Everyone in the centre was so helpful and professional, it made everything go really smoothly and even dispelled any fears I had about the needle!

author: corridorbn47
title: Being a student counsellor at Change Grow Live
body: I am a student Counsellor on placement at CGL cheshire and Merseyside counselling service. I have had other counselling placements but this placement differs in that I feel part of a team, I feel part of CGL. I like the structure of the placement, from the induction, Crisis training, to the careful allocation of clients and the phone call to let us know about the client allocation. I am enjoying learning from my fellow student counsellors, the group work classes I have attended have helped me. I feel supported and I am supported by Amanda, who is the counselling and volunteer coordinator for Cheshire and Merseyside. Amanda is a woman of many talents, from decorating the counselling rooms, assessing clients, matching clients to counsellors and having an open door to us student counsellors, and much more. I feel proud to be part of the counselling team, my experience is positive.

readBy.name: Change Grow Live

author: polar1234
title: The Midwives at BGH and community Midwives
body: I was very anxious going into Labour all 3 times, (the first time in 2018 and my last 2 weeks ago) the community midwives at Duns/Eyemouth who assisted me throughout my pregnancies were all incredible and reassured me throughout. I’ve had all of my 3 children at the Borders General Hospital and can not praise the midwives there enough. Margaret was there for my 3 births and each time she delivered the best of care and made me feel so at ease and safe, she was amazing. Joyce was also great throughout my second Labour, nothing was ever too much for her and was so very helpful towards me and my partner, we’ve never forgotten her kindness. Kizzy the student midwife that helped me through my 3rd Labour was unreal and will make the most wonderful midwife, she knew exactly what to say and made me feel so calm. Thank you to every one of them for helping bring our babies into the world!

readBy.name: NHS Borders
Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Noimagination
title: Reasonable adjustments
body:
Have NHS GGC heard about reasonable adjustments?  
Why do they think it's acceptable to have a morning only clinic with the last appointment at 1110 that services those from the other side of the city? Have you forgotten people have carers who dont get someone up till 10 and need to work to their times? How on earth does someone with mobility issues get to a 1040 appointment at the other end of the city when the carers don't finish till 1020 and patient transport wish them to be ready for collection at 8am? How is it acceptable for forward planning to expect patients to phone after 3pm the afternoon before the appointment to find out the pick up time?

readBy.name: Scottish Ambulance Service
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
Office of Clare Haughey, MSP for Rutherglen

author: hydrusrn57
title: The Staff Are Brilliant
body:
When I arrived in Daisy Hill I was brought up to the Day Procedures Unit by a nurse for my blood transfusion. Everything so far has been great,  
I missed the time for lunch here but I got a cup f tea so I have been very well looked after. I must say the staff are excellent, I just don't know how they do it! My heart really goes out to them and I think they deserve so much more of a pay rise than they are getting. I couldn't ask for better care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: statusxj43
title: Back to square one
body: I got locked up for having a mental breakdown and the police found a lot of alcohol in my system, I didn't think I had a problem and have been drinking for about 14 years, the police thought I needed help and put me on an order with the Alcohol services in Sheffield. Throughout Covid I have never once seen a doctor or had a face to face appointment, no checks have been made to check on my mental health or how I am feeling. The service ended and I am back on the drink, I rang the services again and was told I will receive a telephone appointment. This is a waste of time, my mental health is not good, they cannot see how I am over the telephone. I feel that I need to go to prison to get help. Nothing is in place for me and I am back at square one.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sheffield

author: cassiopeiarr47
title: hospital admission
body:
I would like to show my appreciation of the Willows Ward Bluestone Unit, run by a good ward manager, Mary.  
The nurses were caring, polite and hard working.  
I would especially like to thank Dr OMuirithe and Dr Otesanya. The ward staff deal with anything that comes their way quickly, efficiently and quietly.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sambajf58
title: A Great Experience in the Emergency Department.
body: I came into the emergency department myself about 2 hours ago. My foot was very swollen and sore so I wanted to get it checked out. I have had a blood sample taken and I'm waiting for an x ray for my foot, so I think everything is running quite efficiently so far. The staff are very polite and helpful and the air conditioning is great down here so I have no complaints!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff are really good
body: My stay has been fine so far but it is too warm. All the staff are really good, I have no issues with them. They communicate with me well. The delivery suite was fine apart from the long wait to get started. The bed is comfy enough.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff keep me well updated
body: My experience has been very good, everyone is so nice and lovely. The staff communicated well and kept me informed. The bed is comfy and the facilities are clean. My baby is in the antenatal unit, the staff keep me well updated and the doctors are always in and out informing me of any progress.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everyone is lovely
body: My experience has been good. Everyone is lovely and really helpful. They keep me well informed and the nurses are there to help me when I need it. I am in a nice, clean, private room with a comfy bed. The food is lovely. Everything is perfect.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The room is clean and comfy
body: My experience has been very good, the staff are great. The room is clean and comfy, and the toilets and showers are okay too. The staff in Antenatal unit keep me well updated and the nurses in 2 West even phoned down for an update for me. I can think of no improvements, everyone is really nice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have had a good stay
body: I have had a good stay. I was brought up from the outpatient clinic and everything was good there, I couldn't complain. The staff on this ward are A1. I couldnt ask for better. They are keeping me well informed. The ward is too warm, you would need a fan. The ward is cleaned regularly and thoroughly especially when someone is moved out of it. The food isn't too bad, there is enough variety on the menu. I could think of no improvements to make.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Kept me well informed
body: I have been well looked after in the hospital. I came in through A& E which wasn't too bad, I waited 6 hours to see a doctor. The staff were very pleasant and have kept me well informed of everything going on. Everything is explained in a way I can understand and I feel I can ask questions. The ward is clean.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff were great
body: I have had no problems. The staff are good, they'll do anything you want. The food is always good and the room is comfy. My experience in Emergency department was good too, the staff there were great and I was offered tea.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cammy585
title: Fully discussed my options
body: I had my dermatology appointment with Dr Dilworth. I would like to thank her for her relaxed professional manner. She made my consultation patient centred, she fully discussed my options and me feel comfortable and at ease.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire
Partnership for Change

author: pelicanpq64
title: I was pleasantly surprised
body: I arrived in Daisy Hill last night and have found everything to be very forward and efficient. I have been informed of everything from I entered ED to being brought up to the ward and knew exactly what was happening at all times which was great. It feels like there are plenty of staff as they are so attentive and very open about everything. As much as I had a good experience here I am looking forward to going home later today.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
